challenge.title: Design for a Client
challenge.description: Web designers most often design websites for a client. Find a friend or family member, learn about them and create the wireframes and digital mockup for a site based on their needs.

challenge.title: Design Digital Mockups
challenge.description: Before a website is coded, designers finesse the details by making mockups in graphics applications like Photoshop or Gimp. These mockups should look almost exactly like the final, coded site will look.

challenge.title: Design Digital Wireframes
challenge.description: Graphics applications can make experimentation fast and easy. Careful though, this process is for trying many quick ideas, not perfecting one idea – that will come next.

challenge.title: Saw Wood
challenge.description: Saws have been around for thousands of years. There are all kinds of saws – hand saws, circular saws, miter saws, table saws, and more. Use a saw to make a project with joints that are tight and clean.

challenge.title: Plant a Seed
challenge.description: Raise a seedling in a tray until it is large and strong enough to transplant. Start it off indoors and take special care of it before it goes in the ground.

challenge.title: Make a New Paintjob
challenge.description: Stop and look around – almost any object can be customized using a paintbrush or a stencil. Cleaning, sanding, and priming your surface will help paint stick. After your paint is dry, spraying or painting on a clear finish will help protect it.

challenge.title: Prepare Eggs
challenge.description: A chef hat contains 101 folds. They represent the 101 ways to prepare eggs that chefs in France had to learn. Eggs are still the basis of thousands of recipes – which will you try?

challenge.title: Produce Maple Syrup
challenge.description: Indigenous peoples living in the northeastern part of North America discovered maple syrup. If maple trees grow near your home, you can perform their technique. Carefully tap your trees and boil the sap. You better learn how to make pancakes, too!

challenge.title: Cook Stew
challenge.description: Since ancient time people have used meat scraps and leftover veggies to make tasty stew. No matter how you dice it, stew is a staple of winter survival and they say the best stew sticks to your ribs and keeps you warm well after you've eaten it.

challenge.title: Manage a Simulated Civilization
challenge.description: Our civilization is a complex system made of smaller systems. This can be modeled with games. Can you lead a civilization from the bronze age into space? Can you transform a pasture to a city? Post a shot of your civilization to solve the Challenge.

challenge.title: Learn a Winter Sport
challenge.description: You can have the  power to move swiftly on skis, skates and boards. Ascend mountains and hills just to zoom back down, or confront slippery frozen pools and glide over them gracefully.

challenge.title: Train an Animal
challenge.description: Many animals have active, inquisitive minds that love to learn.  Be a kind, consistent trainer so you can teach an animal the best way to behave.  Document your training sessions with photos, video, or a progress journal.

challenge.title: Care for an Animal's Coat
challenge.description: Fur, feathers, shell, or scales, every animal likes having clean and healthy skin.  For best results, give these treatments on a regular basis.  Be sure to take a video, or before and after photo of the process!

challenge.title: Perform Animal First Aid
challenge.description: Practice your first aid skills so you can be ready in any emergency!  If you can't find a live animal with a lot of patience, models, stuffed animals, and even humans can be useful substitutes.

challenge.title: Build a Prototype
challenge.description: A great way to see if a new design works is to build a prototype of it. Some prototypes are simple, just made to get a feel for size or shape. Other prototypes actually work exactly like a real product.

challenge.title: Drill and Screw
challenge.description: Learn to drill and use screws to construct a wooden object! Screws are strong, simple and fun to attach. Drilling a slightly smaller hole first is a good way to prevent wood from splitting when you put in a screw.

challenge.title: Plane Wood
challenge.description: Planes are used on rough cuts of wood to flatten, square, and smooth a surface. Planers can range in size from small hand planers to powerful motorized ones. Learn to use a planar to bring the surface of your project to perfection.

challenge.title: Build a Wooden Box
challenge.description: A good box doesn't just hold stuff. It's also a work of art. If you're dedicated, you can create a wooden box that's as beautiful as it is functional. If you oil or finish it, it'll last centuries.

challenge.title: Make A Costume
challenge.description: Make a costume using a material of your choice. It should be bold and eye-catching, but also comfortable and sturdy. May you frighten or enchant all who look upon you!

skills.title: Gardener
skills.description: Gardeners keep soil, water, and sun in balance – bringing abundance and beauty to the land. We all need gardens around us. Plants and their flowers, seeds, fruits, and roots are essential to life. Even in our urban centers, where concrete covered the earth long ago, we build gardens.

skills.title: Gamer
skills.description: Computer games are powerful tools to design, build, cooperate, strategize, and lead. The best Gamers use computer games to stretch their creativity beyond the limits of the real world. Building characters and levels inside a game is the first step toward making your own game one day.

skills.title: Industrial Designer
skills.description: Industrial Designers work to make the objects in our lives more usable, beautiful, and ergonomic. They design for people, solving important problems with innovative and unexpected solutions. They apply art and science in equal measure to all things – from better cars to more usable computers.

skills.title: Chef
skills.description: Through alchemy of fire and knife, a Chef brings out the best in food. Chef literally means "chief," or head of the kitchen. They must be a chemist, artist, and entertainer, all at once. Food is energy and we are drawn to it by nature. A Chef transforms food into art.

skills.title: Painter
skills.description: Painters are passionate about how the world appears and they share this with others. They rejoice in the ways that light, shadow, and color surrounds us. Painters have a deep grasp of brushes, oils, watercolors, and canvas, but their most important tool is the eye. A Painter must look, closer.

skills.title: Darkness Engineer
skills.description: October 31st would be just another day, if not for the great Darkness Engineers of our time. Using the latest in cutting-edge zombie goo and world-wide-spider-webs, they innovate on the frontiers of fear. With technology developed by Darkness Engineers, the world is a scarier place for us all.

skills.title: Woodworker
skills.description: With focus, with grace, Woodworkers create objects of timeless utility and beauty. The patient craftsmanship of a Woodworker is seen in every cut, every joint, every peg of a box, a cabinet, or clock. Masters of the hand tool, devotees of the fine grain, Woodworkers carry on an age old tradition.

skills.title: Veterinarian
skills.description: A Veterinarian can diagnose a dog, bandage a bull, and tend to a tortoise, all in one day.  Veterinarians care for animals who suffer, to heal and remedy their ailments. A Veterinarian has extensive medical knowledge of animals, and extends compassion for patients who can't speak for themselves.

skills.title: Yeti
skills.description: A large, hairy creature resembling a human or bear, said to live in the snowy mountains everywhere. Handy in the powder, they are rumored to dwell in a network of snow caves, built by pick axes and primitive shovels. Their sled tracks connect each cave, and they live well where others shiver.

skills.title: Web Designer
skills.description: The internet is full of information, and its up to Web Designers to make it clear, usable and beautiful. A great website design will lead a user to just the right thing, in the right order. There are so many decisions to make, but when Web Designers succeed, the internet is a joy to navigate.
